courseDetails.title: Master MS Word Excel PowerPoint and Google Doc Google Sheets
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn MS Word Excel PowerPoint with Google Docs/Sheets for job readiness, business tasks, and efficient digital workflow
courseDetails.longDescription:
Master the essential digital skills needed in every modern workplace with this complete training on MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, Google Docs, and Google Sheets. This all-in-one Microsoft Office Masterclass and Google Workspace Training takes you from beginner to advanced with clear, practical, real-world lessons.

Whether you need strong office productivity skills, document formatting, spreadsheet data analysis, presentation design, or professional documentation, this course will guide you step by step using real business examples. You will learn how to create polished documents, analyze and visualize data, prepare business reports, build powerful presentations, and manage workflows efficiently using both Microsoft Office and Google Workspace tools.

Designed for students, job seekers, office professionals, freelancers, business owners, and anyone needing practical data entry & reporting and business productivity tools, this course covers everything required to work confidently in any professional environment.

What You Will Learn

  • Master MS Word tools for professional document creation, editing, layout, and formatting

  • Build strong MS Excel skills for data entry, formulas, functions, charts, tables, and data analysis

  • Create clean and modern presentations using MS PowerPoint with smart design principles

  • Work confidently with Google Docs: formatting, collaboration, document styling, and workflows

  • Analyze data and build smart spreadsheets in Google Sheets using formulas, charts, and automation

  • Improve overall office productivity using both Microsoft Office and Google Workspace

  • Learn real-world business tasks: reporting, documentation, presentations, and productivity workflows

  • Understand file management, sharing, cloud storage, and online collaboration

  • Apply professional formatting techniques for resumes, reports, and business documentation

  • Use shortcuts, automation basics, templates, and productivity hacks for daily work

Who This Course Is For

  • Anyone wanting to learn Word, Excel, and PowerPoint and Google Workspace

After Completing the Course, You Will Be Able To

  • Create professional documents, reports, resumes, and forms with MS Word and Google Docs

  • Build, analyze, and visualize data using spreadsheets in MS Excel and Google Sheets

  • Design polished and engaging presentations using MS PowerPoint

  • Perform real workplace tasks with accuracy, confidence, and speed

  • Use both Microsoft Office and Google Workspace for business communication and collaboration

  • Apply productivity techniques for faster, more efficient workflows

  • Handle data entry, reporting, and documentation tasks for office and business roles

  • Work confidently in corporate, academic, or freelance environments

This course is designed to give you real, usable skills that instantly improve your productivity, confidence, and career opportunities. By mastering MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, Google Docs, and Google Sheets, you will be prepared for any job that requires strong office and digital communication skills. Enroll now and build the professional foundation you need to succeed in today’s competitive workplace.
targetAudiences: Anyone who want a complete introduction to Microsoft Office and Google Workspace

Whether you're a beginner, office professional, student, teacher, freelancer, or business owner, this course shows you exactly how to combine traditional Office skills with modern AI-driven workflows to save time, automate tasks, and create high-quality work faster and more accurately.

By the end of this course, you will not only become confident in using Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, but you will also learn how to integrate AI assistants to write better content, analyze data, build presentations, generate ideas, and speed up repetitive work. This makes it ideal for improving productivity, accuracy, and overall professional performance.

What You Will Learn

  • How to combine Microsoft Office with AI for real-world tasks

  • How to use ChatGPT, Google Gemini, and Microsoft Copilot to automate Office work

  • AI-powered formulas, data analysis, dashboards, and automation in Excel

  • AI-enhanced slide creation, design, storytelling, and templates in PowerPoint

  • How to create reports, emails, proposals, resumes, and presentations using AI tools

  • How to build automated workflows that reduce manual work and improve accuracy

  • Real-world examples, downloadable files, templates, and ready-to-use AI prompts

Why This Course Is Different

This is not just another Microsoft Office tutorial.

It is a complete AI-enhanced productivity system built for modern workplaces.

You will learn a combination of traditional Office skills, AI automation techniques, practical real-life applications, and step-by-step demonstrations using ChatGPT, Gemini, and Copilot. This integrated approach ensures you work faster, smarter, and more efficiently.

Who This Course Is For

  • Anyone wanting to leverage ChatGPT, Gemini, and Copilot with Office tools

After Completing This Course, You Will Be Able To

  • Work confidently in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

  • Use AI tools to speed up writing, data analysis, and design

  • Automate repetitive tasks using ChatGPT, Gemini, and Copilot

  • Produce higher-quality documents, spreadsheets, and presentations

  • Increase productivity using Microsoft Office with AI

If you want to stay competitive and productive in the modern workplace, this course will equip you with the essential skills you need. Enroll now to learn Microsoft Office with AI step by step, gain hands-on practice with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and discover how ChatGPT, Gemini, and Copilot can transform the way you work. Start today and build the AI-driven digital skills that employers demand.

courseDetails.title: Advanced Wordpress Course for Professionals
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn E-commerce Website Development, E-Learning Website Development, Forum Making, Elementor Uses
courseDetails.longDescription:
Do you want to learn professional wordpress for web design and development?

This is a professional wordpress course for learning E-commerce Website Development, E-Learning Website Development, Forum Making, Elementor Uses and many more.


Throughout this course, you will acquire the necessary skills and knowledge to build different types of websites using WordPress. We will start by covering the fundamentals of WordPress, including installation, setup, and understanding the dashboard. From there, we will explore various themes, plugins, and customization options available to enhance the visual appearance and functionality of your websites.

Next, we will focus on E-commerce website development. You will learn how to integrate popular E-commerce plugins, set up product catalogs, manage inventory, configure payment gateways, and create a seamless shopping experience for your customers. We will also discuss strategies to optimize your online store for maximum conversion and user experience.

Moving forward, we will dive into E-learning website development using WordPress. You will discover how to create and manage online courses, set up membership access, implement quizzes and assignments, and track student progress. We will explore plugins specifically designed for E-learning platforms and discuss best practices for creating engaging and interactive educational websites.

In addition, we will explore the process of building a forum using WordPress. You will learn how to set up user registration and login systems, manage user roles and permissions, create discussion boards, and foster a thriving online community. We will also cover strategies for moderation and user engagement to ensure a positive and constructive forum environment.

Throughout the course, we will heavily utilize Elementor, a user-friendly page builder plugin that enables you to design and customize your website with ease. You will learn how to leverage Elementor's drag-and-drop interface, pre-designed templates, and advanced styling options to create visually stunning web pages that reflect your unique brand and vision.

By the end of this course, you will have a comprehensive understanding of WordPress web design and development, along with the skills to create E-commerce websites, E-learning platforms, and engaging forums. Whether you are a beginner or have some experience with WordPress, this course will equip you with the knowledge and confidence to build professional websites for yourself or clients.

So, if you're ready to embark on an exciting journey of WordPress web design, E-commerce development, E-learning implementation, and forum creation, enroll in this course now and let's dive into the world of WordPress-powered websites with Elementor!
targetAudiences: Beginner who want to learn wordpress professionally

courseDetails.title: Fiverr Freelancing For Absolute Beginners: Basic to Advance
courseDetails.shortDescription: Fiverr Success MasterClass Course: You Complete Fiverr Guide
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you eager to kickstart your freelance career and tap into the lucrative world of online freelancing? Look no further! Our comprehensive course, "Fiverr Freelancing For Absolute Beginners: Basic to Advance," is designed to equip you with the knowledge and skills needed to thrive on one of the world's leading freelance platforms, Fiverr.

In today's digital economy, freelancing has become a viable and flexible career choice for individuals from all walks of life. Whether you're a student, stay-at-home parent, aspiring entrepreneur, or simply someone seeking to supplement their income, Fiverr offers a wealth of opportunities to showcase your talents and earn a steady income from the comfort of your own home.

This course is tailor-made for absolute beginners, meaning no prior freelancing experience is required. We'll take you on a step-by-step journey from the very basics to advanced strategies, ensuring that you're well-prepared to make a meaningful impact on Fiverr's competitive marketplace.

Here's a glimpse of what you'll learn throughout this course:

  1. Introduction to Fiverr: Get acquainted with the Fiverr platform, its history, and its vast array of services.

  2. Setting Up Your Fiverr Profile: Learn how to create a compelling profile that attracts clients and sets you apart from the competition.

  3. Niche Selection: Discover how to identify and select the right niche for your freelance services based on your skills and passions.

  4. Creating Gig Offers: Craft persuasive gig listings that entice potential buyers and convert them into clients.

  5. Pricing Strategies: Master the art of pricing your services competitively while maximizing your earnings.

  6. Building a Portfolio: Showcase your expertise and build trust with clients by creating an impressive portfolio.

  7. Effective Communication: Learn how to communicate with clients professionally, understand their requirements, and deliver exceptional service.

  8. Managing Orders and Workflow: Get insights into order management, handling revisions, and maintaining a smooth workflow.

  9. Time Management and Productivity: Discover time-saving techniques to optimize your freelancing career and achieve work-life balance.

  10. Marketing and Promotion: Explore advanced strategies for promoting your services and expanding your client base.

  11. Handling Challenges: Learn how to navigate common freelancing challenges, such as handling difficult clients and dealing with disputes.

  12. Scaling Your Freelancing Business: Take your freelancing career to the next level by scaling your services and increasing your income.

Throughout the course, you'll have access to practical exercises, real-world examples, and expert tips to ensure you're well-prepared to embark on your Fiverr freelancing journey. By the end of this course, you'll have the confidence and skills needed to establish a successful freelance career on Fiverr and achieve your financial goals.

courseDetails.title: Gestão de Empresas e Empreendedorismo
courseDetails.shortDescription: Geração de Ideias, Planeamento Empresarial, Financiar o seu Negócio, Considerações Jurídicas, Marketing e Vendas
courseDetails.longDescription:
Bem-vindo ao programa: Programa Avançado em Negócios e Empreendedorismo


Curso ministrado pelo MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

O MTF é o instituto global de educação e pesquisa com sede em Lisboa, Portugal, focado em educação híbrida (presencial e online) para negócios e profissionais nas áreas: Negócios e Administração, Ciência e Tecnologia, Banca e Finanças.

O centro de P&D do MTF concentra-se em atividades de pesquisa nas áreas: Inteligência Artificial, Machine Learning, Ciência de Dados, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Criptomoedas e Ativos Digitais, Metaversos, Transformação Digital, Fintech, Comércio Eletrónico, Internet das Coisas.

O MTF é parceiro oficial da: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, membro da Câmara de Comércio e Indústria Portuguesa.

O MTF está presente em 215 países e já foi escolhido por mais de 560 000 alunos.


Autor do Curso: O Dr. João Martins é um gestor e empreendedor experiente, com mais de 30 anos de experiência em cargos de alta gestão nos setores de telecomunicações e TI. Começando num ambiente académico, onde obteve o seu doutoramento em Engenharia e um MBA na Universidade Nova de Lisboa, evoluiu rapidamente para cargos de C-suite no ambiente corporativo, tanto em grandes empresas como em startups. Atualmente é administrador e acionista de uma startup integradora de TI em Lisboa, focada em cibersegurança. Apaixonado por educação, é também Professor convidado na Nova Information Management School, lecionando Gestão do Conhecimento e Análise Financeira a alunos de pós-graduação e graduação.


O curso "Introdução ao Empreendedorismo" é projetado para permitir uma compreensão básica do empreendedorismo, a sua importância na economia moderna e as skills essenciais necessárias para ter sucesso como empreendedor.

Ao longo do curso, os alunos irão explorar vários aspetos do empreendedorismo, incluindo geração de ideias, planeamento de negócios, financiamento, marketing e operações.

O curso também aprofunda as características que definem empreendedores de sucesso e as diferenças entre empreendedorismo e propriedade de pequenas empresas.

Serão utilizados estudos de caso reais para ilustrar a aplicação destes conceitos em cenários práticos.

No final do curso, os alunos terão uma compreensão abrangente do que é necessário para iniciar e crescer um negócio de sucesso e estarão equipados com o conhecimento para navegar nos desafios do empreendedorismo.


Empreendedorismo é o processo de identificar oportunidades, inovar e assumir riscos para criar e gerir um empreendimento comercial. Envolve a vontade de suportar a incerteza e a capacidade de adaptação a circunstâncias em mudança para alcançar o sucesso. Empreendedores são indivíduos que embarcam nesta jornada, utilizando a sua criatividade, visão e determinação para dar vida às suas ideias. Existem várias razões principais pelas quais os indivíduos optam por se tornar empreendedores e construir os seus próprios negócios:


Busca pela Paixão: Muitos empreendedores são movidos pela paixão por uma determinada ideia, produto ou serviço. Eles querem concretizar a sua visão e causar um impacto significativo na sua área de atuação.

  • Independência Financeira: Construir um negócio de sucesso pode proporcionar liberdade e independência financeira. Os empreendedores têm a oportunidade de criar riqueza para si e para as suas famílias, capitalizando as suas próprias ideias e trabalho árduo.

  • Flexibilidade e Autonomia: O empreendedorismo oferece a flexibilidade de definir o seu próprio horário e trabalhar em projetos que se alinhem com os seus valores e objetivos pessoais. Os empreendedores têm autonomia para tomar decisões e moldar a direção dos seus negócios como acharem melhor.

  • Desejo de Inovação: O empreendedorismo é frequentemente impulsionado pelo desejo de inovar e criar algo novo. Os empreendedores procuram resolver problemas, revolucionar indústrias e apresentar soluções inovadoras que melhorem a vida das pessoas.

  • Crescimento Pessoal e Realização: Construir um negócio pode ser uma experiência profundamente gratificante que promove o crescimento pessoal e a realização. Os empreendedores enfrentam desafios, superam obstáculos e aprendem lições valiosas ao longo do caminho, o que pode levar a uma sensação de realização e satisfação.


Aprender sobre negócios pode fornecer conhecimentos e habilidades essenciais que apoiam o processo de construção de uma carreira e lançamento de uma startup. Algumas maneiras pelas quais aprender sobre negócios pode ser benéfico incluem:


Compreender a Dinâmica do Mercado: Uma sólida compreensão dos princípios de negócios pode ajudar os empreendedores a identificar oportunidades de mercado, avaliar a procura pelos seus produtos ou serviços e desenvolver estratégias eficazes para alcançar o seu público-alvo.

Gestão Financeira: Aprender sobre finanças e contabilidade é crucial para gerir os aspetos financeiros de um negócio, incluindo orçamento, previsão e gestão de fluxo de caixa. Esse conhecimento é essencial para tomar decisões informadas e garantir a saúde financeira de uma startup.

Marketing e Vendas: Estratégias eficazes de marketing e vendas são essenciais para atrair clientes e fazer crescer um negócio. Aprender sobre princípios de marketing, branding e aquisição de clientes pode ajudar os empreendedores a desenvolver estratégias para promover eficazmente os seus produtos ou serviços e impulsionar as vendas.

Liderança e Gestão: Aprender sobre os princípios de liderança e gestão pode ajudar os empreendedores a construir e liderar equipas de alto desempenho, delegar tarefas de forma eficaz e criar uma cultura de trabalho positiva dentro das suas organizações. No geral, aprender sobre negócios pode fornecer aos empreendedores o conhecimento, as habilidades e a confiança de que precisam para navegar pelos desafios do empreendedorismo, construir negócios de sucesso e atingir os seus objetivos.
targetAudiences: Sem requisitos especiais. Um curso para qualquer pessoa que queira construir uma carreira em Gestão

courseDetails.title: Building AI Integrations with Model Context Protocol (MCP)
courseDetails.shortDescription: From MCP Foundations to Real Integrations with Claude and Cursor
courseDetails.longDescription:
The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is emerging as a core standard for how AI systems connect to tools, data, and external capabilities. This course provides a practical, end-to-end understanding of MCP—from first principles to real integrations—so you can design AI agents that scale cleanly across tools, models, and environments.

You’ll start by learning why MCP exists: the M × N integration problem that plagues modern AI systems, and how MCP reframes it into a composable, extensible architecture. From there, you’ll explore MCP’s core components, capabilities, and communication flow—building a clear mental model before touching any implementation.

Once the foundations are solid, the course moves into hands-on development. You’ll build MCP servers and clients from scratch, understand the JSON-RPC 2.0 message protocol that powers MCP, and work with streamable HTTP transport for real-world usage. Finally, you’ll integrate MCP servers with modern AI tooling like Claude Code and Cursor, showing how MCP fits naturally into today’s AI-powered development workflows.

Throughout the course, the focus stays on conceptual clarity, architectural correctness, and real-world applicability—not just getting something working, but understanding why it works and how it scales.


What You’ll Learn

  • What MCP is, why it exists, and how it solves the AI integration problem

  • How MCP defines and manages “context” through tools, resources, prompts, and sampling

  • The roles and responsibilities of MCP hosts, clients, and servers

  • How MCP communication flows from user request to server execution and back

  • How to build and test MCP servers and clients using FastMCP

  • How MCP uses JSON-RPC 2.0 and streamable HTTP transport

  • How to integrate MCP with modern AI development tools like Claude Code and Cursor


Who This Course Is For

  • AI engineers and developers building agentic systems

  • Platform and infrastructure engineers evaluating MCP as a standard

  • Developers integrating LLMs with tools, data sources, or internal systems

  • Technical leaders who want a clear architectural understanding of MCP


Why This Course

Most MCP resources focus on snippets and setup. This course focuses on mental models, system design, and real integration patterns, so you can confidently explain MCP, implement it correctly, and use it as a long-term foundation for AI applications.

Enroll now and master the Model Context Protocol!

Introduction to the Program Management Module

The module introduces program management, highlighting its strategic role in managing related projects to achieve broader organizational goals. The session is divided into four stages:


  1. What is Program Management

  2. The Role of a Program Manager

  3. Understanding Projects – key stages, artifacts, documents, meetings, and activities.

  4. Program Management Methodologies – including benefits and challenges.


Key Concepts and Insights

What is Program Management?

  • Definition: Coordinated management of related projects for strategic alignment and value delivery.

  • Focuses on improving organizational performance, managing interdependencies, and delivering consolidated benefits.


The Role of a Program Manager

  • Operates at a strategic level to align projects with organizational objectives.

  • Distinct from a project manager, focusing on coordination, strategic outcomes, and long-term benefits.

  • Responsibilities include program planning, resource allocation, governance, and change management.


Strategic Program Alignment

  • Ensures programs contribute to organizational strategy through proper planning and alignment.

  • Involves stakeholder engagement, governance, and risk management.


Program Lifecycle Management

  • Phases include:

    • Initiation: Defining vision, stakeholders, and initial planning.

    • Planning: Roadmaps, risk assessment, and governance.

    • Execution & Monitoring: Tracking progress and benefits realization.

    • Closure: Consolidating outcomes and transitioning deliverables to operations.


Benefits Management

  • Focus on achieving long-term value through effective tracking, analysis, and transitioning deliverables into operations.


Stakeholder Engagement

  • Active management of relationships and communication to align stakeholder needs with program objectives.

  • Tools include communication plans and risk identification strategies.


Governance

  • Establishes a framework to ensure programs align with organizational policies and maintain transparency.


Key Takeaways

  • Program management delivers strategic benefits beyond individual projects.

  • Involves a lifecycle approach from initiation to closure, with a focus on long-term outcomes.

  • Core skills include strategic thinking, leadership, risk management, and stakeholder alignment.


Summary of the Program Management Module Detailed

This course is divided into 4 stages. The first one is “what is Program Management”, the second one is the role of a program manager, the third stage is “Understanding Programs: Key Stages, Artifacts, Documents, Meetings, and Activities”, and the last one focus on the methodologies, benefits and challenges.


This lesson is structured in eight stages, each diving into key aspects of program management:


Introduction to Program Management: We’ll start by understanding what program management is, its importance, and how it differs from project management. This includes exploring the definition, key objectives and expected outcomes, along with its history and evolution.


Then, we will have the Key Functions and Responsibilities as a Program Manager: This section will examine the strategic role of a program manager, their essential competencies and critical responsibilities, such as strategic planning, stakeholder management, risk, and quality governance.


The Program Management Lifecycle: Here, we’ll cover the program management stages, from initiation to closure, along with important artifacts and documents like the program charter, benefits realization plan, and risk register.


Key Functions in Program Management: This part will emphasize strategic alignment, benefits management, resource allocation, and financial oversight, focusing on metrics that track program performance and impact.


Methodologies and Frameworks in Program Management: We’ll dive into common frameworks such as Managing Successful Programmes (MSP), Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), and hybrid models, along with essential tools for program oversight.


Challenges in Program Management: In this section, we’ll discuss challenges like cross-project dependencies, stakeholder expectations, scope creep, and solutions for communication breakdowns and resource constraints.


Advanced Program Management Techniques: This includes leadership approaches, adaptive communication, and ethical decision-making, along with case studies that highlight best practices in successful programs.


Program Management Benefits, Metrics, and Evaluation: We’ll conclude by discussing metrics for assessing program impact, long-term benefits realization, and continuous improvement for future programs.


Throughout these lessons, you will gain insights into the comprehensive scope of program management, its methodologies, and the skills required to ensure successful program outcomes.


This structure will reinforce the strategic importance of program management in achieving organizational goals.


What is Project Management?

Project management is the organized application of knowledge, processes, skills, and tools to guide a project from its beginning to its successful completion. It involves:

  • Defining goals: Deciding what the project should achieve.

  • Planning: Mapping out the steps and resources needed.

  • Executing: Putting the plan into action, directing the team, and managing resources.

  • Monitoring and controlling: Tracking progress, managing changes, and addressing issues.

  • Closing: Reviewing the project, documenting results, and learning from the experience.


What is Business Project Management?

Business project management refers to applying project management principles within a business setting. These projects focus on achieving business objectives such as:

  • Launching new products or services

  • Improving or automating business processes

  • Restructuring departments

  • Implementing new software systems


The Role of Project Management

Project management plays a critical role in businesses because it:

  • Increases Efficiency: A well-defined project plan helps streamline work and avoid wasted effort.

  • Ensures Results: Project management keeps the focus on meeting defined goals within time and budget restrictions.

  • Manages Risk: Potential problems are anticipated and mitigated through careful planning and monitoring.

  • Improves Communication: Clear communication channels among team members, stakeholders, and clients help avoid misunderstandings.

  • Improves Client Satisfaction: Successful project completion within agreed-upon parameters builds trust with clients.


Why is Learning Project Management Important for Companies?

Companies invest in their employees' project management training because:

Competitive Advantage: Companies with strong project management capabilities deliver projects more successfully, gain a reputation for reliability, and outperform competitors.

Reduces Costs: Inefficient projects cost more due to delays and wasted resources. Project management helps optimize resources.

Enhances Employee Morale: Well-run projects minimize stress, improve team collaboration, and create a sense of accomplishment.

Improves Innovation: Structured project management allows for managing innovation projects, leading to a culture of innovation within the company.


How Project Management Skills Boost Your Career

Developing your project management skills can significantly enhance your career prospects:

High Demand: Project managers are in demand across industries like IT, construction, healthcare, etc.

Better Salary: Skilled project managers often earn higher salaries due to their expertise.

Leadership Potential: Project management provides a solid foundation for taking on leadership roles within organizations.

Versatility: Project management skills apply to a wide range of jobs and roles, not just project management positions.

Personal Growth: You'll build organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills, making you an asset to any team
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in Project Management

courseDetails.title: Build Your Best Cold Email Strategy!

courseDetails.longDescription:
No matter what product you sell or what services provide, in the modern crowded digital world, it can be difficult to get noticed as there may be dozens or even hundreds of other businesses competing for the attention of potential customers. Cold email can help to cut through the noise and get your message in front of people who might not otherwise have heard about your business. It is also the most cost-effective way to reach a large audience which will definitely come in handy if you have a startup and are limited in budget.


Cold email is a great marketing tool that involves sending unsolicited emails to potential customers or clients. It is typically used as a way to reach out to a large number of people at once, with the goal of getting them to take some kind of action. With a well-thought cold email strategy, you are more likely to engage a highly targeted audience that is interested in your product or service.


WHAT WILL YOU LEARN IN THIS COURSE?

  • Find out the key differences between cold emails and spam so that your cold emails never get into spam folders

  • Get to know how to choose only verified email addresses for cold outreach with the help of Hunter in order to increase the likelihood that recipients will take action

  • Learn how to enable email automation of your campaigns using email templates and dynamic attributes to save a ton of time

  • Understand how to write cold emails that get responses and how to build authority backlinks with cold outreach


Get the knack for cold emailing right now!


My name is Anton Voroniuk and I would like to teach you how to set up an effective cold email campaign step-by-step. I am the CEO of the Digital Marketing Academy SkillsBooster, and a co-owner of Webpromo Agency. During this time I have created hundreds of effective and engaging email campaigns that connected with customers and drove results. Now I’m ready to teach you how to build your best cold marketing email strategy from scratch!


YOU’LL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN COLD EMAIL MARKETING FROM TOP DIGITAL MARKETING PROFESSIONALS:

  • We have over 15 years of experience in online marketing. Our Webpromo Agency has both Google Premier Partner status and Facebook Marketing Partner status.

courseDetails.title: Professional Diploma in Program Management
courseDetails.shortDescription: Program Management vs Project Management, The Role of a Program Manager, PM Methodologies, Program Management Office
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to Program: Professional Diploma in Program Management by MTF Institute


Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 215 countries and has been chosen by more than 620 000 students.


Author of the course:

Ana Cristina M. B. Saraiva is a distinguished professional with a robust blend of academic and industry experience, specializing in management, strategic development, and ethical leadership. She earned her Ph.D. in Management from Lusíada University, where she excelled in research management, critical analysis of management models, and advanced research methodologies, earning recognition for her contributions to the field.

She currently serves as a Project Manager at the Portuguese Association of Business Ethics (APEE). Her role underscores her commitment to driving ethical innovation and sustainability in both public and private sectors.

In academia, she has made significant contributions as a consultant and researcher at Lusíada University’s COMEGI research center. She has collaborated with esteemed national and international institutions, including IST (Lisbon University) and various European universities, to advance research and implement cutting-edge solutions in management and organizational practices. Her editorial expertise includes managing and indexing scientific journals in Scopus, DOAJ, and other prestigious platforms, reflecting her dedication to high standards in academic publishing.

Her industry experience spans over a decade, including pivotal roles in luxury hospitality, where she led efforts in event coordination, quality assurance, and guest satisfaction. She has a proven track record of enhancing operational excellence and strategic management, making her a versatile leader capable of driving results in diverse settings.

Ana Saraiva’s extensive scholarly output includes numerous peer-reviewed articles and conference presentations that address critical issues in management, ethics, and digital transformation. She is adept in a wide range of digital tools and platforms, such as SPSS, SAS, and NVivo, which she leverages to optimize research and business outcomes.

With a passion for interdisciplinary collaboration and a commitment to ethical and sustainable practices, Ana Cristina M. B. Saraiva is dedicated to empowering organizations and individuals to achieve excellence through innovative solutions and responsible leadership in the global business landscape.


Introduction to the Program Management Program

The course introduces program management, highlighting its strategic role in managing related projects to achieve broader organizational goals. The session is divided into four stages:


  1. What is Program Management

  2. The Role of a Program Manager

  3. Understanding Projects – key stages, artifacts, documents, meetings, and activities.

  4. Program Management Methodologies – including benefits and challenges.


Key Concepts and Insights

What is Program Management?

  • Definition: Coordinated management of related projects for strategic alignment and value delivery.

  • Focuses on improving organizational performance, managing interdependencies, and delivering consolidated benefits.


The Role of a Program Manager

  • Operates at a strategic level to align projects with organizational objectives.

  • Distinct from a project manager, focusing on coordination, strategic outcomes, and long-term benefits.

  • Responsibilities include program planning, resource allocation, governance, and change management.


Strategic Program Alignment

  • Ensures programs contribute to organizational strategy through proper planning and alignment.

  • Involves stakeholder engagement, governance, and risk management.


Program Lifecycle Management

  • Phases include:

    • Initiation: Defining vision, stakeholders, and initial planning.

    • Planning: Roadmaps, risk assessment, and governance.

    • Execution & Monitoring: Tracking progress and benefits realization.

    • Closure: Consolidating outcomes and transitioning deliverables to operations.


Benefits Management

  • Focus on achieving long-term value through effective tracking, analysis, and transitioning deliverables into operations.


Stakeholder Engagement

  • Active management of relationships and communication to align stakeholder needs with program objectives.

  • Tools include communication plans and risk identification strategies.


Governance

  • Establishes a framework to ensure programs align with organizational policies and maintain transparency.


Key Takeaways

  • Program management delivers strategic benefits beyond individual projects.

  • Involves a lifecycle approach from initiation to closure, with a focus on long-term outcomes.

  • Core skills include strategic thinking, leadership, risk management, and stakeholder alignment.


Summary of the Program Management Course Detailed

This course is divided into 4 stages. The first one is “what is Program Management”, the second one is the role of a program manager, the third stage is “Understanding Programs: Key Stages, Artifacts, Documents, Meetings, and Activities”, and the last one focus on the methodologies, benefits and challenges.


This lesson is structured in eight stages, each diving into key aspects of program management:


Introduction to Program Management: We’ll start by understanding what program management is, its importance, and how it differs from project management. This includes exploring the definition, key objectives and expected outcomes, along with its history and evolution.


Then, we will have the Key Functions and Responsibilities as a Program Manager: This section will examine the strategic role of a program manager, their essential competencies and critical responsibilities, such as strategic planning, stakeholder management, risk, and quality governance.


The Program Management Lifecycle: Here, we’ll cover the program management stages, from initiation to closure, along with important artifacts and documents like the program charter, benefits realization plan, and risk register.


Key Functions in Program Management: This part will emphasize strategic alignment, benefits management, resource allocation, and financial oversight, focusing on metrics that track program performance and impact.


Methodologies and Frameworks in Program Management: We’ll dive into common frameworks such as Managing Successful Programmes (MSP), Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), and hybrid models, along with essential tools for program oversight.


Challenges in Program Management: In this section, we’ll discuss challenges like cross-project dependencies, stakeholder expectations, scope creep, and solutions for communication breakdowns and resource constraints.


Advanced Program Management Techniques: This includes leadership approaches, adaptive communication, and ethical decision-making, along with case studies that highlight best practices in successful programs.


Program Management Benefits, Metrics, and Evaluation: We’ll conclude by discussing metrics for assessing program impact, long-term benefits realization, and continuous improvement for future programs.


Throughout these lessons, you will gain insights into the comprehensive scope of program management, its methodologies, and the skills required to ensure successful program outcomes.


This structure will reinforce the strategic importance of program management in achieving organizational goals.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in Project and Program Management

courseDetails.title: The Complete SQL Course: From Zero to Data Analyst
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master Foundational to Advanced SQL Concepts, including Joins, Subqueries, and Window Functions
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you ready to unlock the power of data? This comprehensive course is your all-in-one guide to mastering SQL and launching your career as a Data Analyst. Whether you're a complete beginner or a professional looking to add a crucial skill to your toolkit, this course will take you from zero to hero.


SQL (Structured Query Language) is the universal language of data. It is the most in-demand skill for data related jobs, including Data Analyst, Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, and Database Administrator. This course is designed to provide you with a solid foundation and advanced practical skills to confidently tackle real world data challenges.


What You’ll Learn:

  • What SQL is and how it works in real world databases

  • How to write SQL queries from scratch using MySQL and PostgreSQL

  • How to filter, sort, and transform data using SELECT, WHERE, GROUP BY, HAVING, and more

  • How to join multiple tables and work with relational databases

  • How to use aggregate functions, subqueries, and window functions

  • How to analyze data and answer real business questions

  • How to design reports and prepare data for visualization tools


This Course Include

Module 1: Introduction to SQL and Databases   

  • What is SQL and Why is it Important?

  • Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS).

  • Overview of Popular RDBMS: MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and SQLite.

  • Installing and Setting up SQL Tools and Environment.


Module 2: SQL Basics   

  • Understanding Database Structure: Tables, Rows, and Columns.

  • Writing Your First SQL Query.

  • Basic SQL Commands: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE.

  • Data Types in SQL.


Module 3: Querying Data 

  • Sorting Data with ORDER BY.

  • Limiting Results with LIMIT (MySQL) and FETCH FIRST (PostgreSQL).

  • Pattern Matching with LIKE and Wildcards.


Module 4: Advanced Query Techniques   

  • Aggregate Functions: COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX.

  • Grouping Data with GROUP BY and HAVING.

  • Joining Tables: INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, FULL OUTER JOIN.


Module 5: Database Design and Normalization    

  • Designing a Relational Database Schema.

  • Primary Keys, Foreign Keys, and Relationships.

  • Normalization and its Forms: 1NF, 2NF, 3NF.


Module 6: Managing Databases and Tables   

  • Creating, Modifying, and Deleting Databases and Tables.

  • Adding Constraints: NOT NULL, UNIQUE, CHECK.

  • Indexing for Performance Improvement.


Module 7: Advanced SQL Concepts   

  • Views: Creating and Managing Virtual Tables.

  • Stored Procedures and Functions.

  • Triggers and Events in SQL.


Module 8: Working with Multiple RDBMS   

  • Differences Between MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and SQLite.

  • Connecting SQL with Python for Automation.

  • Using SQL with Data Visualization Tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).


By the end of this course, you will not only be proficient in SQL but also understand the mindset of a data analyst. You will have the skills, knowledge, and confidence to land a job or start a career working with data.


Start learning SQL today—and take your first step toward becoming a Data Analyst.
targetAudiences: Students or career changers looking to break into the data industry
Developers who want to add SQL to their toolbox
Business professionals who need to work with data reports and dashboards
Beginners with no prior experience in SQL or databases

Risk management is the process of identifying, assessing, and controlling potential threats to an organization. These threats, or risks, could stem from a wide variety of sources.


Here are the main focuses of risk management:

  • Identification: Finding potential risks that could affect your organization or project. This involves brainstorming, looking at past issues, and considering what might happen in the future.

  • Assessment: Determining the likelihood of those risks happening and how severe the impact would be if they did. This helps prioritize which risks need the most attention.

  • Control: Taking steps to reduce the likelihood of the risks happening or to minimize their impact if they do. This might involve things like putting safety procedures in place, buying insurance, or having backup plans.


Why is it important?

  • Minimizes losses: By identifying and managing risks, companies can reduce financial losses, protect their reputation, and avoid legal issues.

  • Improves decision-making: Risk management provides a framework for making informed decisions, considering potential downsides and opportunities.

  • Enhances resilience: It helps companies to be prepared for unexpected events and to bounce back quickly from setbacks.

  • Increases the likelihood of success: By addressing potential problems proactively, companies can increase their chances of achieving their goals.


For managers specifically:

  • Protects their team: Managers are responsible for the safety and well-being of their team. Risk management helps them create a safe work environment and minimize potential harm.

  • Builds trust: Employees trust managers who are prepared and take steps to protect them from risks.

  • Improves performance: When risks are managed effectively, employees can focus on their work without worrying about potential problems.


In uncertain world, risk management is more critical than ever. It's an essential skill for companies and managers who want to thrive in the face of challenges.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business and risks

courseDetails.title: Ethically Hack the Planet Part 2
courseDetails.shortDescription: Let's Secure the world
courseDetails.longDescription:
"Ethically Hack the Planet Part 2" is an advanced cybersecurity course that delves into the intricacies of network penetration testing and ethical hacking. Building upon the foundational knowledge gained in Part 1, this course extends the understanding of cybersecurity concepts to a deeper level. One of the core components of the course is the exploration and practical use of Metasploitable 2, a purposely vulnerable virtual machine that provides a safe environment for hands-on learning and experimentation.

The course covers essential techniques such as network scanning to identify IP addresses within a network. Students learn about banner grabbing, a method to gather information about a target system, including the operating system, software versions, and more. Understanding port numbers and their associated services is a crucial aspect of the course, particularly focusing on commonly exploited ports like FTP (Port 21), SSH (Port 22), Telnet (Port 23), SMTP (Port 25), HTTP (Port 80), and ports 139, 445, and 1099.

FTP, SSH, Telnet, SMTP, and HTTP are explored in detail, discussing their functionalities, vulnerabilities, and potential security risks. Practical exercises involve utilizing ethical hacking techniques to assess and secure these services, thereby preparing students to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities in real-world scenarios.

By the end of "Ethically Hack the Planet Part 2," participants will have a comprehensive understanding of network security, ethical hacking methodologies, and the tools necessary to assess and fortify network infrastructures against potential cyber threats. The course empowers individuals to use their knowledge and skills for constructive purposes, promoting a safer and more secure digital landscape."
targetAudiences: For IT beginners and ethical hackers.

Have you ever searched for hours for images that properly capture your message or vision, still without finding a perfect match?

Guess what? With the current state of AI and AI art generation technologies like Firefly, creating visuals tailored to your specific needs is no longer a barrier and now costs just a fraction of what it used to!


What is Firefly?


Adobe Firefly is a standalone web application that offers new ways for ideating, creating, and enhancing visuals and design elements using generative AI.

In addition to the Firefly web app, Firefly-powered features are also available in other Adobe products such as Express, Photoshop, and more.

Adobe created Firefly to be safe for commercial use, using content without copyright restrictions for training their models. This sets it apart from many other generative AI models, which could cause copyright issues for businesses and organizations.

Apart from commercial viability, Firefly’s explosive popularity, with 3 billion images generated by users since its launch in March 2023, has great potential for businesses and individuals looking to explore generative AI solutions.


Why is it time to learn Generative AI?


Generative AI is a set of technologies that can create original content, generate insights from large amounts of data, translate languages with near-human accuracy, and potentially even make complex decisions.

ChatGPT, DALL-E, Midjourney, Firefly, and GitHub’s Copilot are some well-known examples.

The rapid advancement of generative AI technologies is now reshaping industries and businesses through new operating models, new products, and services.

Learning about these technologies now prepares individuals for the jobs of tomorrow, ensuring they remain relevant and competitive in an evolving job market.


Course Highlights:


  • 5+ hours of HD video content, step-by-step tutorials, and activities.

  • Course handbook with 200+ examples of how Firefly's style effects and your prompt description could influence the final output.

  • Advanced techniques on crafting effective Firefly prompts with such tools as ChatGPT, MS Copilot, and Adobe Stock.

  • Lectures on generative AI fundamentals, including an overview of the AI landscape and how AI generates art.

  • Learners community to connect with your course instructor and other learners, ask questions, and receive support.

  • Certificate of completion from the FutureVersity School upon completion of the course (available upon request for those who completed at least 80% of the course).


What is the difference between Firefly and Midjourney?


There are things that set Firefly apart from other competitive products, including Midjourney, DALL-E, Stable Diffusion, and others:

  • Everything created in Firefly is designed to be commercially safe for individuals and enterprise creative teams.

  • Firefly comes with a very intuitive, user-friendly, and easy-to-understand interface, so that means you don't have to become a prompt engineer and design instructions densely packed with technical terms and abbreviations like for other similar products.

  • While most generative AI tools focus on a single functionality, Firefly, initially focused on image generation, will eventually provide a variety of tools. Firefly users will be able to remove distractions from photos, change the mood of a video, add new elements to illustrations, test out design options, add texture to 3D objects, and even create digital experiences.

Data analysis is the process of collecting, cleaning, and organizing data to uncover patterns, insights, and trends that can help individuals and organizations make informed decisions. It involves examining raw data to find answers to specific questions, identify potential problems, or discover opportunities for improvement.  


Data analysts transform raw data into actionable insights to help organisations improve operations, strategies, and customer experiences. Core skills include statistical analysis, critical thinking, data visualisation, and proficiency in tools like Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau.


Learning data analysis skills is crucial for career building in today's data-driven world, both for professional positions and managers of all levels. Here's why:  


For Professionals:

Increased Employability: Data analysis skills are in high demand across various industries. Professionals with these skills are more likely to secure well-paying jobs and advance in their careers.  

Improved Decision-Making: Data analysis enables professionals to make informed decisions based on evidence and insights rather than relying on intuition or guesswork.  

Enhanced Problem-Solving: Data analysis helps professionals identify the root causes of problems, develop effective solutions, and track the effectiveness of interventions.  

Increased Efficiency and Productivity: By automating tasks and identifying areas for improvement, data analysis can help professionals work more efficiently and increase their productivity.  


For Managers:

Strategic Planning: Data analysis provides managers with the insights needed to develop effective strategies, set realistic goals, and track progress towards objectives.  

Performance Management: Managers can use data to monitor team performance, identify areas for improvement, and provide targeted feedback to employees.  

Risk Management: Data analysis can help managers identify potential risks, assess their impact, and develop mitigation strategies.  

Innovation and Growth: By analyzing data on customer behavior, market trends, and competitor activities, managers can identify opportunities for innovation and growth.  


Learning data analysis skills is essential for professionals and managers of all levels who want to succeed in today's data-driven world. These skills can help individuals make better decisions, solve problems more effectively, and contribute to the success of their organizations.

Learning data analysis skills is crucial for career building in today's data-driven world, both for professional positions and managers of all levels.

For Professionals:  Increased Employability: Data analysis skills are in high demand across various industries. Professionals with these skills are more likely to secure well-paying jobs and advance in their careers.     Improved Decision-Making: Data analysis enables professionals to make informed decisions based on evidence and insights rather than relying on intuition or guesswork.     Enhanced Problem-Solving: Data analysis helps professionals identify the root causes of problems, develop effective solutions, and track the effectiveness of interventions.     Increased Efficiency and Productivity: By automating tasks and identifying areas for improvement, data analysis can help professionals work more efficiently and increase their productivity.

For Managers:  Strategic Planning: Data analysis provides managers with the insights needed to develop effective strategies, set realistic goals, and track progress towards objectives.     Performance Management: Managers can use data to monitor team performance, identify areas for improvement, and provide targeted feedback to employees.     Risk Management: Data analysis can help managers identify potential risks, assess their impact, and develop mitigation strategies.     Innovation and Growth: By analyzing data on customer behavior, market trends, and competitor activities, managers can identify opportunities for innovation and growth.

Learning data analysis skills is essential for professionals and managers of all levels who want to succeed in today's data-driven world. These skills can help individuals make better decisions, solve problems more effectively, and contribute to the success of their organizations.

Section: Data Analysis (Core Foundational Skills)  This section lays the groundwork for data analysis, covering essential concepts like data collection, cleaning, preparation, and exploratory data analysis (EDA).  It delves into statistical analysis, data visualization, and predictive analytics.  Crucially, it addresses data interpretation, reporting, privacy, and ethics, ensuring a well-rounded understanding.  You'll also gain insights into the tools and software used in data analysis, portfolio building, and career development.

Section: Introduction to Business and Data Analysis (Supplementary Module)  This module bridges the gap between data analysis and business application.  It focuses on understanding business needs, defining problems, and applying data analysis techniques to solve business challenges.  You'll explore data types and sources, business data analysis techniques, and data visualization for business insights.  Case studies and discussions on the role of technology in business and data analysis are included.

Section: Hands-on Experience (Practical Application)  This section emphasizes practical skills development through hands-on exercises using industry-standard tools.  You'll gain experience with Excel, SQL, Python, R, and Tableau.  Exercises focus on tasks like retrieving and analyzing data, handling missing data, conducting statistical analysis, and creating data visualizations.

Section: Data-Based Decision Making (Strategic Application)  This section focuses on using data to inform decision-making processes.  It covers various types of analytics (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive) and how they contribute to data-driven decision-making.  You'll learn about data-driven culture, tools and technologies, and real-world case studies.

Section: Advanced Microsoft Excel Usage (Specialized Skill)  This module dives deep into advanced Excel functionalities, including advanced formulas, data analysis, visualization, data management, and automation with macros and VBA.  The module also talks about AI powered excel with Gemini and Copilot.  It includes numerous practical exercises to reinforce learning.

Section : SQL and SQL for Data Analysis (Database Skills)  This section provides a comprehensive understanding of SQL, covering basic commands, data retrieval and manipulation, advanced queries, joins, subqueries, and data modification.  It also covers query optimization, indexing, and advanced SQL features.  The module concludes with a final project and assessment preparation.

Section: Specialization: Data Analysis in Marketing (Supplementary Module)  This module is focused on the application of data analysis within a marketing context.  It covers marketing data types, sources, key metrics, analytical models, segmentation, predictive analytics, A/B testing, campaign analysis, ethical considerations, and building a data-driven marketing culture.

Section: Specialization: Sales & Service Data Analysis & Analytics (Supplementary Module)  This module is focused on the analysis of data within sales and service enviroments.  It covers topics such as sales trends, pipeline analysis, conversion rate optimization, customer churn prediction, and using data to improve customer support efficiency.  It also covers data sources, quality, and cleaning.

Section: Specialization: Data Quality, Management & Governance (Supplementary Module)  This module focuses on the principles and practices of data governance and management.  It covers data governance frameworks, roles, responsibilities, data quality management, and the use of data governance tools and technology.

Section: Data Based Decision Making and Cost-Benefit Analysis (Supplementary Module)  This module combines data-based decision-making with cost-benefit analysis.  It covers how to gather, analyze, and interpret data for decision-making, and how to conduct cost-benefit analyses to evaluate potential initiatives.  It also covers the tools and technologies used for data-based decision-making.
